subject: Re: [junit] Testing an interface with JUnit
msgSnippet: If you mean a java interface, then you don t test those. You test an _implementation_ of an interface. A mock object, easymock or otherwise, is a way of
messageBody:
If you mean a java interface, then you don't test those. You test an _implementation_ of an interface.

A mock object, easymock or otherwise, is a way of testing the _clients_ of an interface by substituting an alternative implementation. There are interesting trade-offs for the various techniques for implementing mock objects.

Steve

----- Original Message -----
From: FrankSun
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, October 15, 2001 9:45 AM
Subject: Re: [junit] Testing an interface with JUnit


I think the easymock is the best way for testing Interface.
----- Original Message -----
From: Eric Riou du Cosquer
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, October 15, 2001 4:13 PM
Subject: [junit] Testing an interface with JUnit


What is the best way to test an interface with JUnit?
How to use a factory for an interface in JUnit?

Thanks for your help!

Eric
